column1: Take it from Bob and vote for Roger! https://t.co/vtTsQ3e1cZ

During an election it’s important to look at who is supporting who.  90% of contributors to @RogerMarshallMD’s opponent are NOT from Kansas and do NOT represent our values. Listen for more: https://t.co/eV1fcHWyK3

.@RogerMarshallMD will defend agriculture aviation and our armed services. He’s a doctor with an affordable health care plan to protect pre-existing conditions. He will fight against radical ideas like the Green New Deal. Roger will stand up for rural America & Kansas values.
This week I joined @PeteMundo on @kcmotalkradio to talk about #Election2020 and express my support for @RogerMarshallMD. https://t.co/sQP4RBiLP7
These poll results are similar to those we saw in 2014 (leading up to my 11 point victory).  @RogerMarshallMD has momentum. Get out the vote!  https://t.co/HtpK2AFKKG

90% of the contributors for @RogerMarshallMD’s opponent are from out of state and I know what those folks want to see: ➡️ Chuck Schumer changing the rules of the Senate ➡️ Packing SCOTUS ➡️ Laundry list of what they’ve agreed to with Bernie Sanders. https://t.co/sQP4RBiLP7

My fellow Kansans I am concerned about our future. Kansans cannot afford to have a U.S. Senate controlled by Chuck Schumer and Bernie Sanders. That’s why I’m proudly voting for my friend @RogerMarshallMD for the U.S. Senate and I urge you to do the same.
I look forward to casting my ballot for Dr. Roger Marshall in the November election and I encourage every  Kansan to do the same.
This is a crossroads election and we must maintain a Republican majority in the Senate. Roger will run a strong campaign and work hard to deliver results for Kansas.

As Chairman of the Senate Agriculture Committee I have worked closely with Roger to represent Kansas farmers and ranchers. And I know he will bring experience common sense and medical expertise to the U.S. Senate during this ongoing healthcare crisis.
Congratulations to my friend and colleague Dr. Roger Marshall on clinching the Kansas Republican nomination for U.S. Senate.
I know Kansas Republicans will make the best choice for the state on Aug 4. And you can count on me to work with the primary winner to keep this seat in GOP hands.
And yet while I am proud of my accomplishments there is much more to be done. I believe Roger Marshall will continue the fight for the same issues that ensured my re-election for the last 40 years.
Kansans have supported me through 24 elections between my service in the House and Senate. I am forever grateful for the trust Kansans have placed in me all these years.
Roger has also been a strong advocate on behalf of our military installations in Kansas which are crucial to our national security.
Roger's medical experience would surely give him a leg up on Health Committee service which will be critical to our state.

Beyond that Roger is a doctor who can help guide this country through a pandemic that has touched every Kansan. I sit on the Health Committee and know first-hand how important it will be to keep a Kansas view on the committee.
Roger's experience on the House Agriculture Committee will be invaluable as Kansas looks to keep the seat on the Senate Agriculture Committee.
As Chairman of the Senate Agriculture Committee I worked very closely with Roger on the most recent farm bill ensuring that Kansas farmers’ and ranchers’ voices were well represented.

I believe Roger shares the same passion to fight for and protect American agriculture that I have dedicated my 40-year career to championing. He has the support of the Kansas Farm Bureau and the Kansas Livestock Association.
Today I marked my advance ballot for Roger Marshall.
As I look to hand the Senate seat I have been honored to occupy for 24 years to the next Republican I have to make the same choice as all Kansans voting in the primary.
As a Ronald Reagan Republican I always am mindful of his edict to speak no ill of any fellow Republican and that will not change in this election.
